availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Rolland Curry (Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney, and county judge)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, soldier, attorney, and county judge. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Bracken Curry in Harrison County, Kentucky, on October 4, 1816. Father of Eliza Curry McIntosh, James Curry, Martha Curry, and Ann Curry Todd. Served in the United States Army as assistant quartermaster general from October 29, 1812, to January 11, 1814. Resident of Harrison County in 1820. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1820. Resident of Harrison County in 1830. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1830. Engaged in professional employment in Harrison County in 1840. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1840. Attorney in Harrison County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. County judge in Harrison County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.
